channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: North Korea might be making millions -- and breaking sanctions -- selling sand. Yes, sand.
Supporters stand by the US President in Trump country
CNN anchor: This makes us squirm, but it's killing us
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon says Rev. Al Sharpton's eulogy confronted reality that racism killed George Floyd and that truth will make a lot of Americans uncomfortable.

item.title: Floyd laid to rest. Chokehold banned in Phoenix. Seattle sued over police less-lethal weapon use
As George Floyd is laid to rest, his legacy reverberates across the globe
Friend of man shoved by police 'horrified' by Trump's tweet
item.description: President Trump suggested in a baseless tweet that 75-year-old Martin Gugino, who was seriously injured after being shoved by police officers in Buffalo, New York, may have been part of a "set up." His friend Keith Giles says anyone who knows Gugino would find that theory to be "extremely hilarious."

item.title: 19 states see rising coronavirus cases and Arizona is asking its hospitals to activate emergency plans
Nearly 25,000 Covid-19 cases were reported in the United States on Tuesday
Pompeo's 'deafening' silence angers diplomats as protests over racial injustice spread globally
item.description: As protests against racial injustice engulf America and spread globally, State Department officials have suggested Secretary of State Mike Pompeo address his workforce on the issue that, in many ways, directly impacts their work. So far, he has declined to do so, explained sources familiar with the suggestion.

item.title: What will happen to Britain's imperialist monuments?
item.description: On Sunday, Black Lives Matter protesters in Bristol, UK, pulled down a statue of 17th-century slave trader Edward Colston and rolled it through the streets before dumping it, unceremoniously, into the River Avon.

item.title: Black Lives Matter movement presses UK to confront colonial past
item.description: Protesters in the UK did what years of debate did not -- tore down the statue to a British slave trader in Bristol. As the Black Lives Matter movement gains momentum, triggered by George Floyd's death in the US, the UK is being pressed to confront its racist colonial past. CNN's Nic Robertson reports.

item.title: Sweden closes 30-year murder mystery over killing of ex-PM Olof Palme
item.description: Sweden has ended a 34-year investigation into the unsolved murder of the country's then-Prime Minister Olof Palme, saying the main suspect is dead.

item.title: Mitt Romney is now the lone GOP voice willing to stand up to Trump
item.description: GOP Sen. Mitt Romney of Utah may be one of the starkest reminders in the US Senate right now about just how much the Republican Party has changed in eight years.

item.title: Teen cycles 750 miles to take her father home amid lockdown
item.description: A 15 year-old Indian girl, who cycled 750 miles to take her injured father home, has brought attention to the plight of migrant workers caught in the lockdown. Activists say her story highlights desperate measures migrants are taking under the Covid-19 lockdown in India. CNN's Vedika Sud reports.

item.title: Trump Jr.'s Mongolian sheep hunting trip cost US taxpayers about $75,000
item.description: Donald Trump Jr.'s trip to Mongolia last August, where he hunted a rare breed of giant sheep, cost US taxpayers about $75,000 in Secret Service protection, according to documents obtained by a government watchdog group.

item.title: Kremlin spokesperson speaks out on Russia's handling of the virus
Japanese broadcaster takes down controversial Black Lives Matter anime
item.description: Japan's public broadcaster has taken down an anime video explaining the "Black Lives Matter" movement after receiving criticism that the video was offensive and failed to explain the complex racial issues accurately.

item.title: Primary results: Highlights from a messy election night in Georgia and 4 other states
item.description: The lines on Election Day in Georgia were so long that state officials announced investigations before the polls even closed, raising fears of what's to come when the nation votes in November.

item.title: Fox News anchor apologizes after offensive image airs
item.description: Fox News anchor Bret Baier took a moment during his show to apologize for an image that aired comparing stock market performance after widely publicized cases of violence against black men.

item.title: Conservative media is living in the past as unrest subsides across the US
item.description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

item.title: CrossFit CEO resigns after controversial statements about George Floyd
item.description: Embattled CrossFit CEO Greg Glassman is resigning after he sparked outrage over his response to nationwide protests against racial injustice and police brutality.

item.title: Drone footage captures thousands of turtles nesting
item.description: Researchers have captured beautiful aerial footage of thousands of green turtles on the edge of Australia's Great Barrier Reef during the nesting season.

item.title: China removes pangolin scales from traditional medicine list, helping protect world's most trafficked mammal
item.description: The Chinese government has removed pangolin scales from its 2020 list of approved ingredients used in traditional Chinese medicine, a move campaigners describe as a "critical step" towards saving the world's most trafficked mammal.

item.title: Outbreak investigation aboard US aircraft carrier may contain clues about Covid-19 among the young and healthy
item.description: An investigation of a major coronavirus outbreak aboard the USS Theodore Roosevelt aircraft carrier may reveal clues as to how Covid-19 affects younger adults.

item.title: NFL stars call on Clemson University to sever all ties with John C. Calhoun, the slave-owning former US vice president whose plantation became its campus
item.description: Deshaun Watson, DeAndre Hopkins and thousands others have called on Clemson University to rename some of its facilities, notably the Honors College program, that bear the name of slaveholder John C. Calhoun.

item.title: Enoki mushrooms tied to listeria outbreak that killed four people and hospitalized 31, CDC says
item.description: Enoki mushrooms are linked to four deaths and 31 hospitalizations in what the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says was a multistate listeria outbreak that is now presumed to be over.

item.title: 'Gone with the Wind' pulled from HBO Max until it can return with 'historical context'
item.description: HBO Max has pulled "Gone with the Wind" from its library of films.

item.title: The illegal industry booming under lockdown in South Africa
item.description: In South Africa, a coronavirus ban on cigarettes and alcohol has sparked an illegal business. CNN's David McKenzie speaks with soldiers trying to enforce the ban and with a Zimbabwean cigarette smuggler, who says his "profits are up."

item.title: The OTHER crisis of racism in America
item.description: The killing of George Floyd and the national explosion of protests that followed exposed the longstanding crisis of racism in America. But even as we continue pressing for criminal justice reforms, America must not forget the deadly health crisis still afflicting the nation -- another crisis that reflects deep patterns of racial difference.

item.title: Saturn's moon Titan is rapidly migrating away from the planet
item.description: Titan, Saturn's largest moon, is moving away from its planet a hundred times faster than previously established, according to a new study.

item.title: Police officer fired and charged after fatally choking a man during an arrest, police say
item.description: A New Mexico police officer is out of a job and facing an involuntary manslaughter charge after he allegedly used a vascular neck restraint on a man during a traffic stop.

item.title: How the UK became Europe's nation worst affected by Covid-19
item.description: More than 50,000 people in the United Kingdom have died after contracting Covid-19, according to statistic bodies from all of the nations within the UK. CNN's Nic Robertson reports on how Britain reached this grim milestone.

item.title: Harper's Bazaar appoints its first ever black editor-in-chief
item.description: Samira Nasr will become the fashion magazine's first black editor-in-chief in its 153-year-history.

item.title: 'Oh you must be heavy boned.' Marilyn Okoro's fight for body acceptance
item.description: She was comfortable with her body, though others were not.

item.title: New Orleans Saints' Malcolm Jenkins says NFL won't get it right until they apologize to Colin Kaepernick
item.description: New Orleans Saints' Malcolm Jenkins says the NFL needs to apologize to Colin Kaepernick.

item.title: White House prepares new immigration limits, using coronavirus as cover
item.description: The Trump administration is preparing to roll out another set of restrictions on legal immigration, citing the impact of the coronavirus pandemic, even as it argues for the reopening of the US economy, according to sources familiar with the deliberations.

item.title: Roger Federer will miss the rest of the 2020 season after suffering an injury setback
item.description: Roger Federer has announced he will not play tennis again this year after undergoing further surgery on his right knee.

item.title: Adidas says at least 30% of new US positions will be filled by black or Latinx people
item.description: A new hiring initiative at Adidas is aiming to increase the representation of people of color in its North American workforce.

item.title: Protests passed a wedding venue. A bride and groom joined them
item.description: A bride and groom in Philadelphia took a moment out of their wedding day to show solidarity with protesters that were marching against police brutality following the death of George Floyd. HLN's Melissa Knowles reports.

item.title: The world's first Freddie Mercury museum is on an African island
item.description: Down a small, narrow alley in the historic Stone Town neighborhood of Zanzibar, an old building beckons to visitors. Faded photographs are pinned outside the door while inside, a gallery of glossy pictures and old newspaper clippings lead the way to the room's centerpiece: a black piano with an interesting history.

item.title: Face masks make sex safer in the time of Covid-19, NYC Health Department advises
item.description: The New York City Health Department is encouraging people to "be creative" in its updated guidelines to help people have safer sex during the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: NASCAR driver to race with Black Lives Matter themed car
item.description: NASCAR driver Bubba Wallace announced he plans to race a car with a paint scheme dedicated to the Black Lives Matter movement.

item.title: Banksy proposes a new statue that will make 'everyone happy'
item.description: It was only a matter of time before Banksy weighed in.

item.title: Protests continue after George Floyd's funeral
As George Floyd is laid to rest, his legacy reverberates across the globe
item.description: •LIVE: Protests continue across the US after Floyd's funeral

item.title: North Korea might be making millions and breaking international law selling sand
item.description: •Why North Korea has shut off communication with 'enemy' South Korea

item.title: 19 states see rising coronavirus cases with one asking hospitals to activate emergency plans
item.description: • COVID-19 LATEST: New Delhi could have 550,000 cases by August

item.title: Supporters stand by the President in Trump country
Kremlin spokesperson speaks out on Russia's handling of the virus
item.description: • Russia raises stakes with 'brazen' military intervention in Libyan conflict

item.title: China flexes military muscle amid coronavirus pandemic
item.description: As the world is distracted by the Covid-19 pandemic, China appears to be making bold military moves on multiple fronts, causing experts to warn of the tension between the US and China. CNN's David Culver reports.
